title: Additive Manufacturing – 3D Printer Technology

author: Bernd Muschard, Faculty V Mechanical Engineering and Transport Systems, TU Berlin

segmentation: I want to give you a quick overview about 3 printing.
Everyone asked me so 3D printing the next bake revolution.
We are waiting for and is it a revolution?
I don't know.
I think most of the people don't know.
We know that there are many potentials in 3D printing, but I don't think it's a revolution.
I think it's a new kind of technology to produce things and it's it combines with substr, active classical mothera technologies like milling and drilling.
And perhaps it's a bit like with the Internet in the beginning of the Internet, no one knew what can happen with the Internet.
Everyone thought, OK, this is like a big library I can open at home on a computer, and I can look on.
Perhaps I can text to friends or communicate.
But today Internet is much more than just a library or texting.

What is very interesting with 3D printing is that we can make completely new structures and shapes and designs that we couldn't make or we can't make with other technologies with classical subtractive technologies like milling and drilling.
And we can make shape complex geometry's we can tailor structures we can make.

An airplane saves you money and at the same with the car.
